Lisa Calder (I17204) [Female]

2017 posting in my Frazzini guestbook: "First of all I would like to thank you for your site. I have recently confirmed that my biological father is Oreste Frazzini Jr.(Rock Springs Wy) I have always wondered where my genes came from and your site has given me such great insight. I have a half brother somewhere in the world and I would love to meet him. I hope he will visit here and we might connect. Thank you again, Lisa"

Change: 3 Dec 2017

Back to Main Page

Dominick Franklin diPietrantonio (I17205) [Male] b. 2 Jan 1925 PA - d. 15 Feb 1986 Pittsburgh, Allegheny, PA

Event - Military Service : Private US Army WWII

2017 email from Dominic Berhow: "I am attempting to find out information on my paternal side of the family.All the information I have is a name Dominick Franklin DePietrantonio, I know he lived in Chicago in the early part of 1968, most likely served in WW2, and died in approximately 1984. As it was related to me during my childhood, he worked as a typesetter for the Chicago Tribune. He had a brother who was a hypnotist. He was a great guy. I am assuming that this may be the brother I was told about, Name: Mario Depietranton, Birth 2 Nov 1926, Other 1 Apr 2004."

2004 obituary of brother, Mario.

1930 census, Pittsburgh, Allegheny, PA, 5y.

1940 census, Pittsburgh, Allegheny, PA, 15y. Born PA.

U.S., Obituary Collection, 1930-2017 (Mark's note: in about 10 different newspapers)

Name: Mario C Depietrantonio

Gender: Male

Death Age: 77

Birth Date: 1927

Death Date: 1 Apr 2004

Obituary Date: 5 Apr 2004

Newspaper Title: Daily Courier

Newspaper Place: Connellsville, Pennsylvania, USA

DePIETRANTONIO MARIO C. 'LANCE KING'

Age 77, on Thursday, April 1, 2004, in Los Angeles, CA, formerly of Pittsburgh, brother of Elizabeth 'Liz' DiDiano & the late Bart Anthony & Domenic DePietrantonio; uncle of Diane Tomich, Nick (Phyllis) DiDiano & Christine DiDiano; also survived by great-nieces and nephews; son of the late Giocondo & Assunta DiPietrantonio. Friends received at BRUSCO-FALVO FUNERAL HOME, INC. 214 Virginia Ave., Mt. Washington. Blessing Service Wednesday evening 9pm. Visitation Wednesday 2-9pm. Funeral procession and committal service on Thursday at 11am

Published in Pittsburgh Post-Gazette from Apr. 5 to Apr. 7, 2004

Mario C. DePietrantonio, aka "Lance King," 77, formerly of Pittsburgh, died Thursday, April 1, 2004, in Los Angeles, Calif. Brother of Elizabeth "Liz" DiDiano and the late Bart Anthony and Domenic DePietrantonio. Uncle of Diane Tomich, Nick (Phyllis) DiDiano and Christina DiDiano. Also survived by nieces and nephews. Friends received from 2 to 9 p.m. Wednesday at the BRUSCO-FALVO FUNERAL HOME INC., 214 Virginia Ave., Mt. Washington. Blessing service at 9 p.m. Wednesday. Funeral procession and committal service at 11 a.m. Thursday.

Published in Pittsburgh Tribune Review on Apr. 5, 2004

Mario was apparently also known as Lance King. A pseudonym he used as a composer in Los Angeles.

https://books.google.com/books?id=r0ljAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA646&lpg=PA646&dq=lance+king+mario+los+angeles&source=bl&ots=p1C1bAoWNq&sig=E-BlNa89BfTsuX5u5t5SwuV6cGQ&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi16_XSwvTXAhUE34MKHffiBSQQ6AEIRTAI#v=onepage&q=lance%20king%20mario%20los%20angeles&f=false

"King, Lance, pseud. See DePietrantonio, Mario Carman."

https://books.google.com/books?id=r0ljAAAAIAAJ&pg=PA646&lpg=PA646&dq=lance+king+mario+los+angeles&source=bl&ots=p1C1bAoWNq&sig=E-BlNa89BfTsuX5u5t5SwuV6cGQ&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi16_XSwvTXAhUE34MKHffiBSQQ6AEIRTAI#v=onepage&q=depietrantonio&f=false

"DePietrantonio, Mario Carman, 1926- I can't seem to find my way; words by M.C.Depietrantonio (c) 11-18-46; M.C. Depietrantonio, Pittsburgh EU53499"

Change: 7 Dec 2017

Back to Main Page

Domenica Filippa Timperio (I17208) [Female] b. ABT 1854 Sant'Eufemia a Maiella, Chieti, Italy

1905 SEaM digital index #7, of son, Gaetano. The surname may have been incorrectly written as Mantenuto. Note that his grandmother's surname was Mantenuto.

It is probable that this person is Domenic Filippa Timperio and that she married Bartolomeo diPietrantonio in 1894, well after Gaetano was born. I cannot find a birth record for Gaetano. His birth may not have been registered. In the 1880's it was common for people to get married in the Church but then forgo a civil marriage. Later, the law was changed to prevent inheritance to children of people not civily married. Then there was a flood of civil marriages of people who had only previously been married in the Church.

1894 SEaM digital birth record #32 of son Giocondino.

1894 SEaM digital marriage record #7. 11 May 1894. 40y (b 1854). f: Costanzo (fu), m: Irene Mantenuto.

1934 PA WWI PA Compensation App of son, Giocondo.

Change: 8 Oct 2021

Gender: Female

Death Date: Abt 2011

Obituary Date: 14 Apr 2011

Newspaper Title: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette

Newspaper Place: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

Spouse: Barto J. Anthony

Children: Susan, Mark (Shaliss) and Michael Anthony

Siblings: Larry Levine and the late Lorraine Arnold

ANTHONY ELIZABETH J. "BETTY JANE", 76, of Dormont, on Tuesday, April 12, 2011. Beloved wife of the late Barto J. Anthony; loving mother of Susan, Mark (Shaliss) and Michael Anthony; loving grandmother of Brandon and Sebastian; sister of Larry Levine and the late Lorraine Arnold; aunt of Larry Levine; Jessica, Lorraine and the late Robert Arnold; dear friend of Denise Carroll and Heather Zarnich and countless others whom she truly loved. Friends will be welcomed at LAUGHLIN MEMORIAL CHAPEL, 222 Washington Road, Mt. Lebanon, Thursday and Friday 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. A Blessing Service will be held in the Chapel at Calvary Cemetery, Saturday morning at 10:00. If desired, memorials may be made to a charity of one's choice. Published in Pittsburgh Post-Gazette from Apr. 14 to Apr. 15, 2011

Laurie Lee DiMartini (I17226) [Female]

Family tree of Laurie diMartini, found through Ancestry DNA.

https://www.ancestry.com/dna/tests/9F91D2E8-0B4B-4E7B-A0CD-2747BFA0EF5D/match/F99331D0-77B7-4790-8EE1-CF63EF5E7F10?filterBy=ALL&sortBy=RELATIONSHIP&page=1

email from herself, Laurie Lee DiMartini, June 2019: "I just now saw your message on ancestry.com. Yes yes yes!!! You are correct it is me. I dont have much information on my grandfather. I did not even know about his side of the family much. Brother sisters mom dad etc. These were all missing links. Thank you so much for sharing this with me. What a wonderful surprise. I am traveling to Italy on 6/29/19 to Sorenno. Its my first time traveling to Italy. its a culinary tour. I would love to meet up with you. My membership here is active but I have been on and off over the years which is probably why I did not see this sooner. Im so glad that you reached out to me. "

DNA match, 4th-6th cousins.

Laurie Lee servied in the US Marines with several tours in Iraq.

Change: 22 May 2022

Edward Lawrence Labate (I17232) [Male] b. ABT 1955 Penne, Pescara, Italy

2021 Sep - Contact via ancestry.com with son, Drew Labate. Drew told me that his father, Edward Jr was adopted in 1960 by Edward and Dora Gatti Labate. He was born in Penne, Pescara, Italy. He was sent to live in an orphanage and given the name Maurizio Giuditti before being adopted.

Michael A. Labate (I17247) [Male] b. 10 Jun 1947 Cleveland, Cuyahoga, OH - d. 6 Jun 2017 Akron, Summit, OH

Michael A Labate

June 10, 1947 ~ June 6, 2017 (age 69)

Michael A. Labate, 69 years of age, passed away Tuesday June 6, 2017 at his residence. Born in Cleveland, Ohio on June 10, 1947, he was the son of the late Arthur S. and Grace (Davis) Labate. Michael grew up in the North Hill area of Akron, and was a graduate of North High School. A longtime resident of Auburn Township, he had resided in Kent the past two plus years, and had formerly been employed as a barber at Inks Barber Shop in Kent for several years. Later he was employed as a Government Security Officer. He had attended The First Baptist Church of Streetsboro. Michael loved classic cars, attending car shows, and his children will forever cherish the memories of dad taking them to the movies, and of his love for them, and their love for dad. Survivors include his son Kevin (Stefanie) Labate of Aurora; daughters Kimberly (Duane) Angle of Katy, Texas and Melinda Labate of Greenbay, Wisconsin; siblings Steve (Becky) Labate of Alliance, Marc Labate, Marta MacClellan of Ellet, Ohio and Nina. 5 grandchildren also survive. He was preceded in death by his wife Dolores F. Labate on March 2, 2011.Visitation will be Sunday June 11, 2017 from 1:00 P.M.-3:00 P.M. at the Green Family Funeral Home & Crematory Service, 4668 Pioneer Trail at the corner of St.Rt. 44, Mantua, Ohio 44255, where his funeral service will begin at 3:00 P.M. A graveside burial will take place on Monday June 12, 2017, 10:00 A.M. at Westlawn Cemetery, St.Rt. 82, Mantua Township, Ohio. Immediately following the burial on Monday a reception will be held for family and friends at the Aurora Inn, corner of Rt. 82 and 306, Aurora, Ohio.

Change: 16 Dec 2017

Ohio, Rutherford B. Hayes Presidential Center Obituary Index, 1810s-2016

Ohio, Rutherford B. Hayes Presidential Center Obituary Index, 1810s-2016 No Image

Name: Theresa Rose Mandoline

[Theresa Rose Frazzini]

Death Date: 3 Feb 2013

Death Place: Youngstown, Ohio, USA

Newspaper Information: Newspaper: News-Messenger (Fremont), Newspaper Date: 06 Feb 2013, Newspaper Page: 2 Column: 1; Repository: Hayes Presidential Library - Fremont, OH; Years Available: 1938-current

THERESA ROSE MANDOLINE

CANTON, MICH.  There will be a Mass of Christian Burial held on Saturday, Feb. 9, 2013, at 10 a.m. at Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church in Youngstown, with the Very Reverend Monsignor Michael J. Cariglio Jr. officiating, preceded by 9:15 a.m. prayer service at the Rossi and Santucci Funeral Home, 4700 Market St. in Boardman, for Theresa Rose Mandoline, 85, formerly of Youngstown, who died on Feb. 3, 2013. A Memorial Mass will be held on Saturday, Feb. 16, 2013, at 10 am at St. Thomas aBecket Parish in Canton, Mich.

Theresa Rose Frazzini Mandoline was born on July 28, 1927, and died on Sunday, Feb. 3, 2013. She was born in Youngstown to Vincenzo and Anna Frazzini.

Theresa married Julius Mandoline on June 21, 1947. She was preceded in death by Julius who died on Aug. 3, 2008. They lived in Liberty Township until 2002 then moved to Canton, Mich. Theresa moved to Genoa after the death of Julius.

She was a lifelong member of Our Lady of Mount Carmel Church and while there, belonged to the Mothers of the Crucifix Society, St. Monica Guild, church choir and Senior Citizens Club. After moving to Canton, she joined St. Thomas aBecket Parish, where she was a member of the Poke n STAB Quilters the Bunko Club and the STA-50 Club.

Theresa was a graduate of East High School and enjoyed arts and crafts, cooking and baking, playing Bingo, shopping, singing and playing Bunko. She loved everything about the Genoa Retirement Center.

She leaves daughters, Joyce Hansen (Hans) of Canton, Mich. and Elaine Chrismas (Robert) of Genoa; granddaughter, Charina Hansen of Canton, Mich.; grandson, Chris Hansen (Emily) of Novi, Mich.; and a sister, Rose Janesh of Struthers.

Friends may call on Friday, Feb. 8, 2013, from 4 to 8 p.m. at the Rossi and Santucci Funeral Home, 4700 Market St. in Boardman.

Burial will take place at Calvary Cemetery.

Family and friends may visit www.rossisantuccifh.com to view this obituary, sign the guest book and send condolences to the Mandoline family.

Change: 5 Feb 2018

2013 obituary of sister, Theresa. Rose lives in Boardman.

Rose Marie (Frazzini) Janesh

February 10, 1934 ~ April 7, 2016 (age 82)

Struthers  A Mass of Christian burial will be held on Monday, April 11, 2016, at 1:00 p.m. at Christ Our Savior Parish/St. Nicholas Church in Struthers for Rose Marie Janesh, 82, of Struthers, who passed away Thursday morning at University Hospital Case Medical in Cleveland.

Rose was born February 10, 1934 in Youngstown, Ohio, a daughter of Vincenzo and Anna Vitullo Frazzini.

She lived in the area her whole life, graduated from East High School in 1952, and was a homemaker. She drove a school bus for many years in the Struthers and Poland School Districts. Rose was instrumental in forming the first softball league in Struthers for girls and served as a coach. She also was an assistant coach for the Struthers High School Girls Softball team. She was a member of Christ Our Savior Parish/St. Nicholas Church, was secretary of the Holiday Bowl Homemakers League, and secretary of the Rolling Hills Golf League, where she had an Ace at hole number 7.

Rose married Robert E. Janesh on June 2, 1956.

Besides her husband, she leaves three children, David E. (Jacqueline) Janesh of Jessup MD, Diane M. (Jeff) Shriver of Earlysville, VA, and Cheryl A. Janesh of Girard; seven grandchildren, Robert A. (Dena) Janesh, Jennifer M. (Andrew Siegele) Janesh, Michael V. Janesh, Aaron Rei-White, Brianna Rei-White, Jacquelyn Kenreich, Carl Kenreich, along with two great grandchildren, Marley Gioia Siegele, and Xavier Joseph Siegele.

Rose was preceded in death by her parents and a son Joseph S. Janesh and a sister Theresa Mandoline.

Friends may call on Monday at Christ Our Savior Parish/St. Nicholas Church prior to the mass from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

Arrangements handled by Clemente Funeral Home, Struthers, Ohio.

Change: 5 Feb 2018
